page.title: 17CHAPEL AREA
page.content: We interviewed Mr Adams,owner of Chapel Dairies.He also owns 360 acres of land,220 cows,2 bulls,100 young cattle(aged 6_9 months)and 40 calves. His machinery includes 7 tractors, several trailors and 12 milk floats, of which 3 are petrol driven and 9 use battery power.These floats have been in use from 1 to 10 years.The dairy was built in 1859 and was taken over by Mr Adams in 1959, who has now lived there for 26 years. It employs 18 people and produces 6000 bottles of milk per day to be distributed in the Newquay area.The old part of the dairy is built from elvan stone and the newer section from steel. Near Quintrell Downs crossroads we discovered some large oil storage tanks which can hold 1100 gallons.6 tankers come in daily to collect and deliver oil.
